pages.description: First sheet of the 2022 California Green Building Standards Code (CalGreen) Residential Mandatory Measures checklist (July 2024 Supplement). Covers Divisions 4.1 through 4.5: Planning and Design, Energy Efficiency, Water Efficiency and Conservation, Material Conservation and Resource Efficiency, and Environmental Quality.

Division 4.1: Planning and Design — site development, storm water, grading, EV charging
Division 4.2: Energy Efficiency — references California Energy Code
Division 4.3: Water Efficiency — kitchen faucets, lavatory faucets, showerheads, outdoor water (MWELO)
Division 4.4: Material Conservation — enhanced durability, construction waste 65% diversion
Division 4.5: Environmental Quality — pollutant control, definitions
EV charging provisions referenced (4.106.4.1, 4.106.4.1.1)
Storm water drainage and retention during construction (4.106.2)
Building maintenance and operation (4.410)

pages.description: Second sheet of the 2022 CalGreen Residential Mandatory Measures checklist (July 2024 Supplement). Covers pollutant control with VOC limit tables for adhesives, sealants, and formaldehyde. Includes indoor air quality and exhaust requirements, carpet/flooring/composite wood/insulation VOC standards, interior moisture control, and installer/inspector qualification requirements.
key_content: 2022 CalGreen Residential Mandatory Measures, Sheet 2 (July 2024 Supplement)
Table 4.504.1 — Adhesive VOC Limits: indoor carpet 50 g/L, wood flooring 100 g/L, multipurpose construction 70 g/L, contact adhesive 80 g/L
Table 4.504.2 — Sealant VOC Limits: sealants 250 g/L, porous primers 775 g/L
Table 4.504.5 — Formaldehyde Limits: hardwood plywood 0.05 ppm, particleboard 0.09 ppm, MDF 0.11 ppm, thin MDF 0.13 ppm
4.505 Indoor air quality: bathroom exhaust fans ENERGY STAR rated, ducted to exterior
4.504.1 Protection of mechanical equipment during construction
4.506.1 Carpet systems: CRI certification referenced
4.506.2 Resilient flooring: FloorScore program referenced
4.506.3 Composite wood: CARB ATCM formaldehyde compliance
4.506.5 Moisture content of building materials — limits before enclosure
4.507.1 Concrete slab foundations: vapor retarder required
703.1 Documentation and installer training requirements
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: specific checkbox completion status for many items
NOT SHOWN: specific exhaust fan CFM ratings (referenced but values not listed on this sheet)

pages.sheet_title: (N) ADU Floor Plan w/ Schedules & Elect.
pages.description: New ADU floor plan with electrical layout, window schedule, door schedule, electrical symbols legend, 1-hour fire rated wall detail, egress standards, plumbing fixture notes, and smoke/CO alarm requirements. This is the primary architectural plan for the ADU interior layout.
key_content: Window schedule: 6'-0" x 4' tempered glass vinyl slider, 4'-0" x 4' vinyl slider (contractor to verify all openings)
Door schedule: 3'-0" x 6'-8" wood entry door w/ security lock, 3'-0" x 6'-8" wood french door, 2'-8" x 6'-8" wood bedroom door w/ privacy lock
Bedroom egress: min 5.7 sq.ft. net clear opening, 24" min height, 20" min width, 44" max sill height
1 HR fire rated exterior wall: 16" OC studs, Type X gypsum board (5/8"), insulation, stucco exterior
Plumbing fixtures: lavatory faucet 1.2 GPM, kitchen faucet 1.8 GPM, showerhead 1.8 GPM, toilet 1.28 GPF (HET)
Smoke & CO alarms: hardwired with battery backup, interconnected, in each sleeping room and vicinity
Electrical: GFCI in kitchen/bath, AFCI for bedroom circuits, dedicated circuits for dishwasher/disposal/microwave/refrigerator
Exhaust fan: Energy Star rated, ceiling mounted, drip CFM min ventilation
Dryer exhaust: rigid metal duct terminated to exterior
Electrical sub-panel shown on plan

pages.description: Structural notes page containing statement of special inspection, seismic and wind design criteria, concrete specifications with strength and mix requirements, reinforcement standards with rebar cover table, and general structural construction notes referencing 2022 CBC.
key_content: Seismic Design Category: D, Site Class: D
Seismic Importance Factor p = 1.3, Risk Category II
Basic Wind Speed = 95 MPH, Exposure Category B, Iw = 1.00
Diaphragm R = 6.5, Equivalent Lateral Force Procedure
Floor live load: 40 PSF, Roof live load: 20 PSF
Concrete: 2,500 PSI (W/C 0.65 normal) or 3,000 PSI (W/C 0.45 moderate)
Type V Portland Cement conforming to ASTM C150
Rebar: ASTM A-615, Grade 60; smooth dowels ASTM A36
Rebar cover: 3" against earth, 2" exposed weather (#4+), 1-1/2" exposed weather (#4-), 3/4" interior slabs/walls
Class B lap splices unless noted otherwise
Non-shrink grout: 7,000 PSI minimum at 28 days
Special inspection required: wood shear walls, diaphragms, concrete, reinforcing steel, epoxy dowels
Governs: 2022 California Building Code
NOT SHOWN: lumber grade specification (covered on SN2)
NOT SHOWN: nailing schedule (covered on SN2)
NOT SHOWN: engineered wood product specs (covered on SN2)

drawing_zones.content: Statement of Special Inspection (5 items) and Design Criteria (seismic, wind, vertical loads)
Concrete specifications (10 items) and Reinforcement notes (6 items) with rebar cover table
General structural construction notes (13 items)

pages.sheet_title: Structural Notes (Nailing Schedule, Mechanical Anchors, Structural Wood)
pages.description: Continuation of structural notes featuring a comprehensive nailing schedule for all framing connections, mechanical and adhesive anchor specifications with testing requirements (10% proof test, 24-hour minimum cure), and structural wood specifications including DFL lumber grades, pressure-treated wood requirements, engineered wood products (Parallam PSL, TJI joists), and Simpson Strong-Tie hardware references.
key_content: Nailing schedule: joist to sill 3-16d, sole plate to joist 16d @ 16" O.C., stud to sole plate 3-8d or 2-16d
Nailing schedule: doubled top plates 16d @ 16" O.C., double top plate lap splice 8-16d
Nailing schedule: rafter to plate 2-16d, rafter to ridge 3-16d
Nailing schedule: rim joist to top plate 8d @ 6" O.C.
Nailing schedule: built-up corner studs 16d @ 24" O.C.
Lumber: DFL No. 2 (2x6 & under), No. 1 all others; Select Structural (4x4+)
Stud lumber/utility 2x4 for cripple walls
Pressure-treated sill plates: CCA-C or ACQ-D, AWPA U1 retention
Fasteners in PT wood: hot-dipped galvanized, stainless steel, silicon bronze, or copper
Adhesive anchors: ASTM A-325 threaded rods, ASTM A-563 Grade A nuts, ASTM F-436 washers
Adhesive dowels: ASTM A-615 Grade 60
Anchor proof testing: 10% of all anchors, no sooner than 24 hours after installation
Engineered wood: Parallam PSL by Weyerhaeuser (ICC-ESR-1387, LARR 25020)
Engineered wood: TJI joists by Weyerhaeuser
Engineered wood: TimberStrand LSL by Weyerhaeuser
Simpson Strong-Tie hardware (LARR25719 Simpson Strong Walls, LARR25725)
Wood moisture content max 19% at time of placing
Plywood sheathing per 2019 CBC Section 4.4.1 & 2308.8.2

drawing_zones.content: Nailing Schedule (1) table with all framing connection types and nail specs, plus toe nail installation detail diagram
Mechanical and Adhesive Anchors specifications (11 items) including testing and installation requirements
Structural Wood specifications: lumber grades (DFL), pressure-treated requirements, plywood/sheathing, engineered wood products (PSL, TJI, LSL), Simpson hardware references

pages.description: Structural sheet showing partial foundation plan (left half) and partial floor framing plan (right half) for new detached ADU. Includes foundation notes (101-107) and framing notes (201-204) below each plan, plus a symbols legend at top center.
key_content: Foundation: 15" wide x 18" deep continuous footing with 2-#4 T&B typical
Slab: 4" slab on grade with #4 @ 16" O.C. each way (see Detail 1/S2)
Foundation bolts: 5/8" diameter, 7" embedment, 48" max spacing, 12" max to ends (see Detail 2/S2)
Concrete: 2500 PSI, Type V cement, W/C ratio not to exceed 0.45, no special inspection required
Sill plate: preservative-treated wood required
Epoxy dowels to existing concrete: 1/2" diameter, Simpson Set 3C (ESR#4057), 8" min embedment
Fasteners in contact with PT wood: hot dipped zinc-coated, galvanized, stainless steel, silicon, bronze, or copper
Wall sheathing at shear walls: 3/4" CD APA plywood or OSB, Exposure 1, span rating 32/16, 8d common @ 4" edge / 12" field
Floor sheathing: 15/32" CD APA plywood or OSB, Exposure 1, span rating 32/16, 10d common @ 6" edge / 12" field
Headers: 4x6 with trimmer stud U.N.O.
Floor joists: 2x6 @ 16" O.C.
Stud wall framing per 8/S3
Shear wall symbols at multiple perimeter locations per schedule on S2
Holdown/post symbols at corners per 4/S2
Washers: min 3"x10"x0.229"
NOT SHOWN: vapor barrier notation
NOT SHOWN: shearwall mark numbers (deferred to schedule on S2)
NOT SHOWN: holdown mark numbers (deferred to schedule on S2)

pages.description: Six tiled pages of the 2022 Single-Family Residential Mandatory Requirements Summary checklist. Covers all California Title 24 mandatory measures including air leakage, insulation, fenestration, HVAC, duct sealing, water heating, solar ready, battery storage ready, PV systems, indoor air quality, and plumbing fixtures. This is the mandatory compliance checklist that applies regardless of performance or prescriptive compliance path.
key_content: 2022 Single-Family Residential Mandatory Requirements Summary (6 pages tiled)
Air leakage and building envelope sealing requirements
Below-grade vapor retarder requirements (slab-on-grade)
Insulation installation quality (Grade I required, HERS verification)
Fenestration products: NFRC certification, U-factor/SHGC labels required through final inspection
Cool roof requirements for Climate Zone 8 (reflectance and thermal emittance)
High-efficacy lighting: all permanently installed luminaires must be high-efficacy
HVAC equipment sizing and efficiency requirements
Duct sealing: mastic or listed tape, duct leakage testing, HERS verification
Whole-house mechanical ventilation per ASHRAE 62.2
Kitchen range hood and bathroom exhaust requirements
Water heater efficiency requirements and pipe insulation
Solar ready: minimum roof area, conduit from panel to solar zone, panel space reservation
Battery storage ready: dedicated panel space, conduit to battery location
PV system requirements for new construction (minimum size by CFA and climate zone)
Plumbing fixture flow rates per Table 150.0-H
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: specific numeric values for most requirements (composited at very small scale)
VALUE NOT LEGIBLE: checkbox completion status for individual line items

drawing_zones.content: Mandatory Requirements page 1: Air leakage, vapor retarder, insulation, insulation certification, fenestration products, roof/ceiling specs
Mandatory Requirements page 2: Pipe lights, electrical/lighting, HVAC, duct sealing, exhaust ducts, pool systems
Mandatory Requirements page 3: Space conditioning airflow, refrigerant charge, ventilation/IAQ, water heating

Mandatory Requirements page 5: Light fixtures/caulking, plumbing fixtures/controls, duct systems, heating, cooling
Mandatory Requirements page 6: Airflow/fan efficacy, solar water heating, domestic hot water, PV systems, battery storage, plumbing, electrical
